review: Just ordered my usual take out and drove to their old spot - didn't realize they moved but HOLY COW! Their new spot is great! Super refreshing vibe on the inside. Happen to order on their first day of opening, very busy, SUPER friendly staff! Marcelo was great!!! Very hospitable and friendly, thanks Marcelo :) I regret calling in a take out order as I would have loved to have enjoyed their new ambiance. Will be back for in restaurant dining!!! Good move guys, place looks great and your staff was hustlin'

Love the new place and location! Food is always amazing! Our server Garrett was great!! Staff here is always super friendly. :) It was so nice of the  2 managers to stop by our table and chat with us for a little bit. My sons favorite restaurant. :) We will definitely be coming back!

Just had a Pizza in the new location and was really surprised how beautiful the new restaurant is ..The Service is Wonderful and the Mushroom Pizza was excellent..Next time your out and about check it out..Its Beautiful!!!
The new location is just terrific! Outdoor seating with heat lamps. Same great food. Staff is just the best.

First time coming here with another person because she wanted me to try out the pizza here. Me being a native New Yorker why not, I love pizza. The interior is very nice and the food is pretty good for the price too. I only ordered a Hawaiian pizza along with my regular ice tea. The reason I only gave them 3 stars was because the wait for my food was about 30min and the new waiter we got just didn't seem like he cared.. We weren't going crazy on complaining, we just wanted to know why did it take so long because the other customers that came a while after us already got their food but his reply was 'It's not my fault.' and then he asked us if we wanted to talk to the manager. The manager was super nice and apologized. After our meal and when we got our receipt we noticed that the manager deducted the total of our meals, she gave it to us for free and was only asked to pay for tip. Very unexpected. We didn't complain because we wanted a free meal..the total of our food wasn't even expensive. Only $33. We both decided to drop $5 inside the receipt book before we left just cause we felt it wasn't right to not pay for the meal. We tried talking to the manager again that we will stay pay but she refused and told us to just pay the tip and explained that they shouldn't be keeping customers waiting for over 15min just for pizza.  Overall, the food and price was good but the wait and how the waiter approached us was kinda rude in some way. I rather pay the meal than pay the tip..  I remember Leo (not sure if he's one of the manager but he seemed like one) and I forgot the closing manager's name (I'm sorry!!) who helped us with the food. Both were super nice! I'll def come back just not with the same waiter again lol sucks how the previous waiter had to take a break and replaced it with someone else who gave no enthusiasm. In case if the waiter was having a terrible day, then I apologize but hey, you always gotta keep smiling when it comes to work. I've been there before many times. Random personal comment/opinion: I still think NYC's pizza is much better though haha xD

Amazing service from our server "G" or "Garrett" according to the receipt ;). WARNING: dry sense of humor! I asked for no ice in my water, when he came to refill it with a pitcher, one ice cube had made it's way into my cup. He apologized and brought me a new glass of non-iced water. LOL. He recommended the avocado egg rolls and they were super delish! I would recommend these to anyone + the Garlic Cream Fettucine with Chicken! Also, the restaurant looks absolutely gorgeous :D, I wasn't expecting this from a CPK. They have a lot of outdoor seating which is great for the summer. They also have a full bar so maybe I'll stop by there next time! Lastly, the general manager stopped by the table to welcome us back for a next time. 6 STARS!

MUCH better than the old location! It's closer to the parking structure, and less foot traffic in that area. The inside is clean, huge, and beautiful.  Service is great - everybody is very responsive and quick.  Food: fresh and probably the best CPK meal I've had.  -White corn guac (3/5): only got this bc we had a free coupon.. it was really good but there wasn't enough guac! Also hard to eat - it should be served in a bowl for dipping ease.  -Waldorf chicken (5/5): YUM! Everything was extremely fresh and delicious. Not too much dressing, and not too many greens ;)  -Roasted garlic chicken (5/5): Cooked perfectly and all of the ingredients were super fresh.

New location but the food is no better. Don't ever order the coffee there, more like colored water. Starbucks is around the corner, bring a cup in if you are planning to have coffee with your dinner or after. Kids pasta dish on the menu has no sauce to speak of. We had to order more sauce.  So many good restaurants in the Walnut Creek area and this one is barely marginal.
Great new location! The food is still bad we won't be back.... Cold spinach dip and pesto pasta was way too salty! Very Very disappointed !

Big fan of cpk chain for multiple years was excited to try the new location in Walnut creek.  Well done location south of the old one in new property with wide open out door sitting.  Rest was downhill.   Poor slow forgetful server, humus very watery from too many tomatoes. Tried the garlic chicken which tasted good but vegetables cold and chicken dry.  My wife had Kung po  pasta with chicken but brought out shrimp.  They rushed a new dish which was overly salted and dry. Forgot bread and condiments.   I Like to attribute the mistakes to new opening but with so many problems clearly poor management.  Please call Restaurant impossible.    I'll stick to other locations.

My husband and I were so disappointed! We asked for bread that never arrived. Our waiter, Marcelo forgot we asked. The hummus appetizer was ice cold and consisted of primarily watery tomatoes. My order was wrong, I ordered Kung Pao Spaghetti with chicken and mine had shrimp. I asked for soy sauce, Marcelo never brought it. I asked for no green onions and it had green onions. When it finally came, it was dry and overly salty.  Our waiter delivered my soda half full in a cracked glass.  When Marcelo gave us the check, we expected we would not be charged for my dish as it was wrong and finally came 10 minutes after my husband's. Marcelo gave us coupons only valid at this location, too bad we won't becoming back. We had to wave him over to take our check for payment and are still waiting for our credit card and receipt.

I've always come here a few times a year since I've moved to Walnut Creek. Haven't been to the new location, but the old location was great.  The service is always quick and their servers and hosts are personable and polite. The pizzas are great, but I especially love the Moroccan Chicken Salad - my favorite! The half size is very filling. They also always give complimentary bread and olive oil. I hope that doesn't change.  Good spot for a quick bite for lunch or dinner! I'll have to check out the new location soon.

I love the new location ...... I don't think they have the staff that is excited about it. The service takes along time getting drinks out, when ordering they forget add ons on your meal, don't come by to see if you need anything. When there a couple by us got their food and when the girl asked for silverware the waitress walked away and actually rolled her eyes and let out a deep breath. The worst part she never came back and we had to flag someone for them. The food, once you get it and if you have something to eat it with is good. Hope it gets better.

Food: 4/5        Price: 4/5         Service:5/5      Ambience: 5/5 I love this new location! Super comfortable, high class, and modern interior, with open spaced outdoor patio and spacious indoor seatings. Our server was very nice and attentive. The complementary sourdough bread with herb olive oil was as delicious as usual.  Today we decided to go with all pastas. Great flavors and good portions, I would just like my fettuccine to be cooked harder. SHRIMP SCAMPI ZUCCHINI is a light option that has an amazing great flavor. CHICKEN TEQUILA FETTUCCINE is just slightly creamy and perfectly delicious. GARLIC CREAM FETTUCCINE was a bit to heavy.  Overall, I love this new location and renovation, I will be back for more! Favorites: * SHRIMP SCAMPI ZUCCHINI ($15.59) - A lighter spin on a traditional recipe. Zucchini ribbons sautéed with lemon, garlic and white wine, tossed with parsley, Parmesan and a touch of fettuccine. * CHICKEN TEQUILA FETTUCCINE ($14.99) - Creamy jalapeño lime sauce with spinach fettuccine, red onions, bell peppers and fresh cilantro. Others: * GARLIC CREAM FETTUCCINE with CHICKEN ($12.59 + 3) - garlic Parmesan cream sauce with fresh Italian parsley

Came here to eat with my family..  The host over looked us and never sat us , instead brought the other families to sit. So me and my family were standing their looking like a deer caught in headlights ...  We were seated when we reminded them that we were waiting for a table and the host wasn't nice at all. at the end of the day .... Never again
I have always loved CPK and this new location is a fantastic addition to the walnut creek area. I got the Moroccan chicken salad which was absolutely delicious. Will be coming back here again.
Kids love it. We like it. Nice family friendly hangout. The only thing that can be improved is level of salt and oil in food. Sometimes its too high on noodles and sandwiches.

My first time at this location in Walnut Creek. If you want to sit outside it can be confusing if you never been here before. You have to walk around to the front to let them know you would like to sit outside. It looks like anyone can seat themselves if they didn't know. I'm vegetarian so I got an entree with out the meat. The Tequila Chicken, w/o chicken. The flavors were ok, nothing spectacular or wanting to repeat. I'll try other items perhaps in the future. Service was on point & available. Around $15.00 for a pasta dish. Pretty moderately priced considering I took the other half home.  Nice location & I would give them another try.

New location is spacious with a very urban, modern vibe and decor. We chose the outdoor seating which is great for warm nights. I ordered the shrimp scampi zucchini which was so good and honestly just the right portion. I coupled it with a glass of sangria and I must say it was a large glass filled with all kinds of fruit. Definitely one of the best sangria from a restaurant I've had. My friend ordered the California Cobb salad and found it to be fresh and again a good portion for an entree. Lastly, we ordered the butter cake for dessert well because the menu says "just trust us"...Lol so we did. It was served warm, very moist and with fresh whipped cream. We added the Häagen-Dazs vanilla scoop! Overall no complaints on the food. It was quite delicious and we left saying we couldn't wait to come back and try other things on the menu. The reason for the 4 stars and not 5 is our waiter was quite impersonal and wouldn't make eye contact with us. He'd walk off as we were asking for items as well. Really odd when you're working for tips too.

This place was so nice! I loved the way it was decorated and the staff was very friendly. Our service was very quick. Food was delicious! I ordered the garlic Fettuccini with shrimp and chicken. I wasn't even that hungry but I ate every last noodle. So good! Definitely will come here on a more regular basis.

Poor service and the food quality has gone way down hill.  Waiter was rude and didn't supply us with utensils or napkins and I had to keep looking for him as my children kept asking for napkins, etc. I ordered the roasted vegetable salad and the artichoke hearts were so hard and chewy you couldn't even swallow them.  Not going back.

On all dimensions, yesterday at the Walnut Creek CPK was a 10! Start with easy parking right under the new location, pleasant servers, the great menu (something for everyone besides just pizza) and delicious food. Our family party to honor a 10 year old was made special.  Cool booklet for the kids during the gap between order and service. Kid specials were eaten with gusto, and the adults enjoyed their appetizers. specialty pizzas, and salads. My "small" and outstanding Cobb salad was plenty for a meal (and I am picky when it comes to Cobb salads). A  great experience all around. We will go back many times.

Don't necessarily come here since it's far away from home. But I used to love this place until they changed the menu a while back. I come every now and then to enjoy a sand which or a hearty pizza. I have never really had a problem with the their service but my most recent visit was a total disaster. I ordered from the lunch menu which was a half California club sandwich with a Caesar salad. I have had this before so I am pretty familiar with what it looks like right when it comes out. To my surprise I ended up with a smokehouse barbecue sand which. I confronted the server Mari and he insists that this is my "California Club" so I didn't even bother talking to him anymore. I asked another server what it was and immediately he answers smokehouse barbecue. I told him the situation and without hesitation he offered to replace it. I didn't catch his name but next time I come in I'll definitely be looking for him to serve my family and I. The manager also made the situation more bearable so props to the other staff.  P.S. Don't argue with the customer. Most of the time we are right.

Pretty much the same CPK menu as always but I'm digging the new décor and layout. Located on Main Street, towards the end of Broadway Plaza and the soon to be open Agora apartment complex, this CPK has revamped their interior. The new, more open layout is appealing along with the simple yet rustic wooden benches. Although I'm sure the ingredients are the same, they are really playing up the farmers/growers aspect of their menu with decorative herbs and pictures featuring California specific agricultural themes.  Food is pleasantly reliable as always. Service needs a bit more attention-the pacing of the delivery and check out was a bit off. I didn't recognize staff from the prior location so maybe everyone in training? Anyway, I am forever a CPK fan and it's still a weekend, go-to spot after shopping or movies in Downtown Walnut Creek. Hopefully its presence will encourage more foot traffic towards this end of town as well. Nicely done all around.

Great new location just two blocks down from the old spot.  This location is much more breezy and has a nice open layout.  The food standard is always to par and they are constantly trying out new things but also keep the staple old.  I love the Thai Crunch Salad and BBQ Chicken Salad.  The BBQ Chicken pizza is also a clutch choice as well.  I found it to be very cold in the restaurant so make sure to pack a jacket!

Nice lite fare, pizza, dad's and more. The  AVOCADO CLUB EGG ROLLS were crisp and warm. They made a wonderful lite meal. My husband had the MUSHROOM PEPPERONI SAUSAGE pizza which he said had a nice little bite to it, and the THE MEDITERRANEAN salad that he enjoyed. The best part of our experience was our server Andy. This young man was cheerful and enthusiastic with a great attitude and wonderfully service minded.

I usually love going to California pizza kitchen but what I experienced this time made me never want to go back to this location in Walnut Creek, CA. Food was good. However when I finished my food. I went to the bathroom and saw a Kitchen Manager walk out of the stall and left the bathroom without washing his hands. Completely disgusting. I'm disgusted. Definitely am never going back.

Honestly, you can never go wrong with a CPK in your neighborhood.  Their california club pizza is one of the best.  Appetizer-wise their avocado club egg rolls and tortilla spring rolls never disappoint.  Those are my go-to items when visiting CPK.  I have ordered their kung pao spaghetti before.  It tastes pretty good but always on the saltier side. When I don't order the california club pizza, I usually opt in to get a half size salad along with what pizzas are chosen.

The food and drinks were good, the service was terrible. We were rushed along the entire time, finally asked for a manager when the check came midway through our meal. Our server did not ask if we needed anything else, which we actually did, before he plopped the tab down.  The manager, "it wasn't personal, we train our staff to be time conscious during the weekday and I'll follow up with him". First, we understand it's not personal, it was just a terrible experience and second it's Saturday and the restaurant is half full. There was no need to rush, especially when we are both still eating. We paid our tab over our dirty dishes.  Terrible service from start to finish, a bad response from management. We will not return.

Companion and I ordered 3 things for lunch; all 3 were totally disappointing and service was bad. First was two Irish Coffees. We waited a loong time. When they came they were coffee with whiskey and sugar but without whip cream. Seriously? Second were the avocado club egg rolls. Large gross unpleasant things. The bacon in them was all you could taste. Thirdly was the pear + gorgonzola thin pizza which we had both enjoyed many other times in the former location. This one was swimming in oil so was oily and bland. Yuck. We would have ordered coffee and dessert and expected our server to come by since our plates were cleared. After 10 minutes she hadn't shown so we paid and left. The final coup de grace was something contained xanthan gum in enough quantity to create a laxative effect on one of us within 20 minutes. Terrible. New location but very disappointing food and service. Pizza Kitchen used to be wonderful because it was predictable and reliable. The new location fails big time.

The food at CPK is pretty standard for the most part, which is part of the reason to go there, at least for me. The service at this location in WC is sub-par and by a long shot.  It was not busy, there were plenty of staff milling around, but our wait person was more interested in chatting with coworkers than taking care of us. No refills, asked how food was as she was already walking away, food did not come out as requested, etc. Maybe it was her lack on care that made the food seem a bit worse? Perhaps it just is. In any event, not a fun experience at this location.
Awesome came in for a quick lunch and got great service from Melissa thank you I had a great first experience.   Deff will come back.

Was really excited to be at the new location. It looks great! They have 3 tv's and great decor. The ambiance is fantastic. My friend and I sat at the bar because it was not too busy. The bartender took forever when there were 3 couples who already had drinks and foods. Once she finally got to us we where able to order out food; margarita pizza and a small salad with drinks. A couple sat next to us who were greeted right away, as it should be. It took a while to receive my drink, the couple next to us received complementary bread and butter while no one else at the bar did. The bartender was checking up on them constantly disregarding other customers. I did have to call out to her to get our bill and place an order to go. Our food came and was delicious and so were the drinks.   I was disappointed with the customer service at the bar, hopefully sitting down is better.

Since they have moved, this place is even better than it was. It look's great inside, manager is very friendly. I love cpk, I'm usually here every other week haha. I love their food, service is a hit and miss. Check it out  My favorite's are : Chipotle chicken pizza Pesto pasta Kung Pao Tortilla soup

Were arrived and were seated quickly and our orders were taken. The snag came when one of our party became nauseous and made a mess. We excused the ill person and attended him outside but none of the staff even bothered to help with the mess at the table or in the Isle. We tried to clean up the mess the best we could but soon we were out of napkins. I went to the bar as no servers bothered to help and got more napkins but they were only so effective. After three CPK staff walked by and one actually stepped in the mess as I cleaned on my hands and knees I decides to see if I could find some rags. The hostess station had some rags and cleaner but no hostess but due to the smell I decided it was best for all patrons to liberate the cleaner and the rags. With these items I was able to complete the clean up just in time to receive the check. Thanks CPK for all the help. You will not see us again.
Service is terrible. The food quality is subpar. The front desk is not attentive. I won't come back again for sure.

Food was absolutely delicious!! I was surprised with how good everything tasted. The only disappointment was that they forgot about us so we were sitting there forever! But the manager hooked us up with free desserts so that was nice.

First time visiting since moving and renovations at the new local. Casual, clean and modern. The Thai pizza and veggie salad rocked. Super awesome. The Cobb salad was average. However the Sonoma cuterer Chardonnay from Napa and the winter ale paired well with our dishes. Service was prompt, attentive and personalized. For a generic chain I loved this place.

Came here for my niece's bday party.  It was a morning event, before they opened up to the public.  The kids got to make their own pizza which was a big hit. Props go to the manager, Skyler, Emily, and the rest of the team for the excellent service, great food (for the kids and parents).   I wished I had younger children so that I could throw a similar party!

The restaurant is beautiful.   The music too loud.  California Pizza? kitchen, the smallest part of the menu is pizza.  We have not been in the new location before and the pizza was only okay.  The server was very nice but very slow.   There is not enough service staff for a Saturday night.   What I do not understand is why a piece of cheesecake would take 15 min to bring.

So the wife used "Door Dash", and this was how the food was presented to us. "BURNT" why send this type of presentation out the door? #shame The appetizers we're good, but the presentation and lack of concern was glaring.

Had a great experience in the new location!! It's the 4th time I'm in the new location of California Pizza Kitchen in Walnut Creek.  Amazing Amazing Amazing! Very refreshing atmosphere, modern style and beautiful design! Service in all times was outstanding. Waiter was very nice and friendly.  Love the new menu dishes. The soups, appetizers and salads are just delicious   Try most pizzas and pastas on the menu they all very good!!! They also offering a new lunch menu which is cool.  Usually we come here for every occasion.  New parking lot located just few steps from the restaurant. The stores and the plaza is also close by.

Came in on a rainy Saturday at 3pm with just myself and my 8 year old daughter. We were seated immediately, but then no one else spoke to us for 15 minutes. It's kind of ridiculous really. The menu looked interesting enough, but after 15 minutes I was annoyed and left. Then I went across the street to lemonade instead.
Everything was super good! The wait staff was on point! Will come back. This is my first time at this new location.

Great experience at new location. Service was top-notch. Food was terrific-ordered many dishes. Went Friday around 2pm, with a party of six. Young hostess was a sweetie and our server was great too. I can see management helping out. The Kung Pao Pasta  was super. A few mentioned that all the dishes were slightly salty, but good. Great job!
Love the new location and bar inside! I've been here a few times since they have relocated. Service is excellent. I had the lunch combo today ceasar salad and turkey sandwich.  Excellent wine list

Food was very good . Service was really bad waited for 15 for the so unfriendly server to come to our table Madeline Was very rude and unpleasant server. Finally we order our food when finally after like 30 min someone else brought our food Our order was wrong . I send it back she never came back to check what was wrong I got up to ask for utensils and plates and napkins . Never ask if we needed it refills for drinks. Finally I went and talk to a manager he was very helpful and brought whatever we needed it. Madeline you are a terrible server 0 customer service and so unpleasant . I will not be coming back to this location . This restaurant needs to get rid of unpleasant servers like Madeline

The new restaurant is much more elegant the the old one.  Good service when it is not busy--otherwise expect a long wait.  Kinda noisy unless you are outside-which I recommend.  Food is tasty.  More variety now.  A little more expensive than it used to be and portions are a little smaller.
Very accommodating and helpful. Great food and outstanding customer service for take out order

New location has not improved the food. Had lunch here today. Pizza and salad were both lackluster. Service was a notch below that. Nice open dining room. Parking garage behind (below) this new site is handy, and free.

The service at the bar was horrible. I'm still trying to figure out how it was only three of us originally and four people came and went we were asked several times if we ordered different meals even while we were eating,  and we still didn't get are food once I did get my pasta was cold. And I watched them clean the glasses they where mixing the disinfected water with the clean water it was just a mess. I always eat at this restutant in different locations and I never had bad experience.

2nd time at this location. First time was on point. This time was polar opposite. Service was horrible. Had to get up and get my own hot sauce. Waited about 20 minutes for drinks. Ordered appetizers we received 2 seconds AFTER we got our mains. Never received my second drink order. My food was disgusting and I didn't eat it. $95 later, all i have is red ears and steam coming out of them. I intended to order items to go, but after all of that, negative dude.

I love this new location of CPK!  I heard they were newly opened in June last year. The décor is modern, the dining room is spacious, the ambience is chic and comfy. Food was deliiiiicious. I'd highly recommend the roasted veggie salad, which has lots and lots of fresh ingredients, and the rolled pasta with wild mushrooms, which was the best dish I had over there! I couldn't stop eating them. The avocado club egg roll was a nice fusion dish. For the pizza, we had the BBQ chicken pizza and the Sicilian, both were good. Service was good too. Our waitress was very friendly and attentive. Manager Andy was walking around, greeting and checking on customers, making us feel welcomed. I'll surely come again when I visit this area next time!

Let me start with the great management and staff, they are amazing.  Now on to the food and amenities. The kids pasta meal was undercooked, they replaced it without charge but after I requested to speak with the manager. Be warned that this place does not have diaper changing station in the men's room. I was able to use the women's room with a guard at the door. When I asked why they don't have a changing station, the response was that we have notified HQ. Does it take much to just purchase one and install it!

I wasn't expecting to celebrate valentine's day last weekend, but I was at California Pizza Kitchen with some friends and they were offering a special Valentine's day Special ($35) that began 2/10- and ends today 2/14.  The special was a smaller menu and gave a few options to choose one appetizer, two entrees and one desert.  So, with 5 adults (two of which were a couple with 3 kids), we all decided to share two Valentine's Day specials.    I haven't been to CPK, in a long time, so it was good to try a variety of their dishes.  For the appetizer we ordered: lettuce wrap with chicken, spinach artichoke dip.  For the two entrees (four for us) we ordered: BBQ chicken pizza, Hawaiian Pizza, BBQ chicken salad, and Thai Crunch Salad.  For the desert we ordered the key lime pie and the butter cake because they ran out of the red velvet cake.  However, the buttter cake was surprisingly really good.   So, how did the food fare?   Given this isn't a fancy, upscale, date type restaurant; I would say overall, the food averaged 3.5.  The bread and olive oil (4).  I love their bread but I didn't eat much of it because of all the food we had coming.  Appetizer- lettuce wrap with chicken (3.5).  The lettuce was on a separate plate so you can put as much chicken and sauce as you like in your lettuce wrap.  Lettuce was fresh, chicken was chopped up into tiny morsels and was already sautéed in some sauce, and there was additional sauce to add that made it more flavorful/tasty.  It was pretty good but nothing really spectacular.  Appetizer- spinach artichoke dip (2.5 stars).  Though, the artichoke dip was incredibly tasty and delicious, the chips which were a combination of blue tortilla and white tortilla were stale.  Actually, some were stale.  I found out this out later from my friends.  I just ate one blue chip and one white chip and said YUCK, that's enough for me!  Apparently, they mixed stale chips with fresh chips here at CPK.  I am glad one of my friends actually told the waitress about this.   BBQ chicken pizza- this is one of my favorite pizzas at CPK (4).  I enjoyed it.  Plenty of BBQ sauce but not so much to overwhelm the chicken, gouda cheese, red onions and cilantro on top.  The thin crust was really good.  It wasn't as thin as some places, which I actually prefer.  Hawaiian Pizza (4.5) - this is also a favorite of mine at CPK.  The waitress was kind enough to see if we could substitute the tomato sauce for a white sauce due to my inability to eat anything with tomato in it because of the acidity.  Unfortunately, there was no other sauce but she asked us if we just wanted it on olive oil, and surprisingly this actually tasted very good.  With fresh ham and pineapple, I wish I had gotten 2 slices!  But we were all sharing.  BBQ chicken salad (3).  Nothing special here.   All the vegetables with the chicken, tortilla strips, and bbq sauce tasted alright.   Thai Crunch salad (3).  Again, nothing special here.  The vegetables, chicken, wonton strips and peanut sauce all tasted ok together.  Key lime pie (4).  Pretty darn good, except we had to split it into several tiny wedges!  Butter cake (4.5).  I did not know what to expect with this one, but it was really delicious cake topped with vanilla ice cream.  It was sweet but not too sweet which was great because it was already topped with vanilla ice cream.  I believe with the Valentine Special there was an option to order a bottle of wine but we did not. I don't remember if that was included in the $35 or you had to pay extra.    The customer service here was excellent (4.5).  The waitress attended to our needs, frequent check-ins, gave us more plates, offered more water, and easy check out.  She was also friendly and conversational.  Atmosphere/environment (3.5), only because it is so loud in here!  Other than that, very spacious, lot's of seating, nice lighting, comfy and casual, modern interior with nice paintings, and clean bathrooms.

First time at the new location and really like the atmosphere and layout.  It was crowded and loud the Saturday of Valentine's weekend, but that is to be expected for a chain that appeals to families, couples and groups of all ages.  They have a large bar area as well, good place to stop by for a drink and appetizer.  The service was very good, friendly, efficient and helpful, and a good team effort bringing out the food.  There were some lengthy gaps in food service, but they were very busy so it was not a surprise, the wait was a good 20 minutes for a table.  They had a good draft beer selection, just wish there was a printed list available to review.  The brussel sprout/bacon flatbread had a nice flavor and good coverage of both ingredients, but was only four small slices, not really much for two to share.  My wife enjoyed the fish tacos, three good sized tacos with very lightly battered fish and chips/salsa on the side.  I was pleasantly surprised at the quality and portion of the hearth roasted halibut, very nicely done for this type of restaurant chain and $25 a very reasonable price for halibut.  Served with grilled asparagus and butternut squash farro & baby kale, it was a very good plate.  Next time we will try some of their pizzas, an interesting variety on the menu.

I haven't been to a CPK in awhile, for good reason. There are lots of better pizza places for the price. Ended up coming here because we didn't want to drive anywhere else after shopping.  First, I didn't know they moved. I'm not thrilled about this location for them. It's poorly lit area and frankly, it's hard to find because it doesn't look like a traditional CPK. Secondly, I don't understand why we got sat all the way in the back and passed many empty tables that were more appealing.  The food as expected was just ok, we got the deep fried mac and cheese appetizer, it was dry and had no flavor. My issue here is the pizza and paying extra for every little thing. You have to pay extra for thin crust. Really? Are the pizzas pre-made and you're that inconvenienced to switch the dough? You have to pay extra for half and half, come on even Pizza Hut doesn't do that. You have to pay extra for pineapple, ok, this I kinda understand, but $1.50 for a few slices? Not ok.  Their only saving grace was that the service was good.

This is hands down my favorite place in Walnut Creek. Service is always awesome, attendance are very friendly, and food quality is always the best. I don't remember ever having bad food here. Managers are always around and asking for input. Only problem is that it's crowded and you know why. It's always a great experience and thank you for that. Parking is ample

I came here in Oct 2015 and i had my dog with me.  My friend, Nala and I sat outside at the patio. I got the Crispy Chicken Sandwich with Spring Mixed Quinoa Salad and it was so good. The server was nice and sweet and acknowledged my dog which was sweet... people who was around was kind and sweet too because they didn't say anything when my dog sat on the chair... She did not want to sit on the ground. Lol and the server didn't give me a hard time about it. Glad some restaurants allows dog...

CPK is such a great restaurant. I find myself always craving their spinach and artichoke dip. It's sooooo delicious! I also love their pasta and salads. Unfortunately they got rid of my favorite mushroom ravioli, so that's the only downside to the menu.  The new location is pretty cool. The ambience is lively and modern too. The service...I feel from the waitresses could be better. My last dine in over there didn't go so well. The waitress didn't bring straws when I asked until our main course came out. I also ordered a pizza to go with my mom that she never wrote down or put in. And she also never bothered to ask if we wanted refills on our drinks. But she was attentive to the other tables around us, so I don't see why she couldn't have been with us.

3 stars because I love CPK in general and the food but the service here at the new location was the worst. We had asked for bread 3 times until they brought it out........after we were already eating our entrees. We didn't even eat it because we already dug into our food and bread was cold and hard. Waiting for about 30 minutes for refills for water after asking twice. You'd think that It was because they were busy but there were literally only 3 other tables in the resultant. The best service we got was the guy who grated our pepper over our pasta.

We went to CPK in Walnut Creek on Friday, they moved the location into a new spot in Walnut Creek and it is much bigger, it has quite a few tables outside for dinning, and its a nice newly remodeled resturant. I order the Baja Chicken Rolls which I happen to love for years, and I also ordered the Chop Salad which is my favorite salad. It was good. California Pizza Kitchen is a nice place for families to eat, it's not a romantic spot for couples but it's cool if you are in Walnut Creek shopping and would like something refreshing to eat. Definitely give it try and have a glass of wine.

Good food, nice new digs, lousy experience. Very. S-l-o-w.  Service. Table for 4 for an office lunch. 45 minutes after being seated they finally take our order. After 65 minutes they bring some bread. After 85 minutes, small plate of bread consumed, water glasses long dry, we ask to see the manager, who comes promptly, apologizes profusely, and promises to personally deliver our meals immediately, and to make things right.  10 more minutes pass, food comes, but not by the manager.  The waiter, protecting his tip, offers to ask the manager for accommodation. We accept. 15 minutes pass, waiter returns, announcing the manager authorized him to comp 2 desserts (for 4 guests). 20 minutes more before the waiter returns to take dessert orders. Now 2.5 hours invested in lunch, we decline, pay the bill and make a...hasty...retreat.

I keep trying these folks. I was given a gift card for them otherwise I would not step foot in this place. Ordered the veggie salad to go, got home and there were NO veggies. The take out gal forgot to include the veggies. I had the pasta with mushrooms. Tasteless. I can't understand how these people can stay in business with food so consistently and ridiculously bad. Plus, it was so noisy. Seems like a new trend at these places. Yuk.

Worst service ever. We waited for ever for drinks and had to decide to forgo dinner. Took so long and they were not even busy... open tables everywhere. This place will fail for sure. Might as well put up a for lease sign already!!

Went here with my baby for some lunch (solo mom day). First thing the hostess and manager did was open the door for me so I could get the stroller in. Then the hostess took me to a table where there was enough room for the stroller to fit which was great. The waitress I had was very nice and always refilled my iced tea. Food was good, got the lunch special Mediterranean salad and  pepperoni sausage & mushroom pizza. I would've ordered the butter cake for dessert but the baby was starting to wake up so I skipped it. Next time :)  When I was leaving, the hostess opened the door for me again.  Service was great and food was tasty.

A good reminder of what horrible service and bad food looks like. I went here after almost an year and it took 40 m for a wine to arrive followed by terrible food. It  is ultra lower class fast food. Avoid

Just came back from this place, food was really good and tasty, food is being cooked very good you can tell they have great chefs ‍ . It was dinner for 12 people I was with some friends. We were there and the negative thing is that servers are very very slow it takes them 10 minutes come come by just to ask what we want to drink, also when we ordered it took them 30 minutes to deliver the food , place was pretty empty around us , is not like there was so many people there. Drinks are not being replaced at all you have to keep on asking for someone to come and replace them. I am very disappointed that we had bad experience again food is great but service is awful truly. Very slow, not customer oriented at all.
Not only they upgraded their location but also their food is now off the hook. I absolutely love this new location. We go back as often as we can.
It was my first time and I had really good time, I wasn't hungry, but I eat all my food , delicious food.  Nice and cool place.

Here's the thing, it's a chain, and it's campy, and bla, bla bla... but it also happens to never disappoint, so quit hating!  Came here on a particularly hot day.  The temperature was wonderful. Enough AC to cool you down, not so much that you're cold in shorts.  The ambiance was great.  You could hear music coming from somewhere, but it wasn't loud enough to interrupt the conversation. The service was with a genuine smile. We got waters and the bread (the free stuff). The bread comes with olive oil with a bunch of herbs that's actually fantastic.  Just fantastic herb oil.  As my paid-drink I got the Cucumber Reviver (puréed pineapple & cucumber with Monin Cucumber, torn mint and agave sour, then topped with club soda).  A few sips and I was revived!  For an app we got the chicken lettuce wraps.  Perfectly round, fresh and crispy pieces of lettuce, great chicken to veggies ratio, interesting sauce with a slight kick.  Wonderful dish. Also got the Banh Mi Bowl (Quinoa, baby kale, fresh cilantro & mint topped with grilled chicken, watermelon radishes, fresh avocado, cucumbers, carrots, bean sprouts, scallions and sesame seeds. Served with housemade chili-lime vinaigrette and serrano peppers).  It was the only disappointing part of the meal.  Nothing wrong with it, just a little bland for my tastes.  Then again, I skimped on the vinaigrette, so that may have been my fault.
Good place for lunch and outdoor seating. I always order the usual Pizza & soup duo.

Foods okay, location is great, but weird service. Ordered some salads, a pasta and a pizza for 4 of us, and they delivered at all at the same time. The food couldn't fit on the table and as we ate our salads, the pizza and pasta got cold.

Super disappointed. We are regular CPK diners. Went to the new WC location and expected the same experience as the old Broadway location. Service was just awful. Tables were dirty when we were seated along with dirty plates, missing utensils. Ordered the warm veg salad with salmon. Just horrible and couldn't even get past a few mouthfuls. Salmon was over fried and tasted like charcoal and the dressing way too tangy. Warm brownies desert (ordered many times before) was served ice cold, right out of the fridge. And to top it off the table next to us had three kids playing soccer with their kids cups and running around the restaurant. Complained to the server and had to move tables. Yet, management did nothing to address the out of control children. I would like to think that management would be concerned about the dining ambiance for the customers in the restaurant. Apparently not the case. Won't be returning and neither should you.

Highly underrated in the pizza game.  While I tend to forget about cpk, it has never disappointed me, never said one thing and meant another, and has never changed their recipes.  That last one is a lie. They changed the recipe, but for the better. Their core sauce and dough still tastes the same but they got some fancy pepperoni and added some nifty basil? (Green stuff) This pizza is crack. There are three ways to eat this pizza. 1. One unfolded slice at a time like a little princess. 2. Folded like you got somewhere to be and need that pizza fast. 3. Deep throat it so you can choke a little (but in a good way) on some of the best ingredients that a chain pizza joint with salads has to offer.  If you can't finish a whole pizza yourself, this review isn't for you.

Chicken Milanese is sooo good, but over 1000 calories.  Tried the Bahn Mi Bowl from their seasonal menu...super fresh & healthy.  The chicken tasted like packaged cold chicken breast (with rib meat) that you'd get in a deli, so they should change that.  Other than that...it was really good. I hope they make it a regular item all year long and use better chicken :)

Let me start my saying this was the worst experience I have ever had! First of all I called to try to place an order ahead of time and I had to talk to 3 different people before they told me I could not place an order, okaaay?? So I came in on my 30 minute lunch break and I did not get greeted for at least 15 minutes and my appetizer (the only thing I ordered) didn't come for another 25 minutes. It got to the point where I had to ask the manager for water. If I could only tip lissa, I would. She was the only person that helped my table. There was no service and they were slow to the point we almost left.

I usually have a salad here but thought I would try the tacos for a change. It was not good.  The fish in the tacos did not taste freshly cooked, in fact, it was tough. The fish was topped with way too much shredded cabbage that looked like it was just pulled out of a bag and thrown on. It was very disappointing. If the 3 tacos had not cost so much, I wouldn't even bother writing this, but dinner was not cheap and this plate was a throw away.

I used  to somewhat enjoy CPK food, as it was lighter than other chain restaurants and the pizza was decent. However, after coming back here for the first time in a while, I noticed that the food here is now all overly sauced and overly salty. Like extremely salty. I love salty foods, and I thought it was way too salty.  The new location's decor is extremely nice. Probably good for a date too. And the new location has better parking, so all plusses, but the food... also, the avocado egg roll was way too oily.  Service has been solid the past few times I have been.

Normally we love CPK, but today we went and the service was HORRIBLE. We won't ever be back to this one again. Everything took twice as long as it should have, we never got our drinks refilled once, we had to ask 3 times for our boxes to go, and twice for the check. They got our order wrong. Just really bad all around.

I'm done with CPK. I have ordered twice now and gotten the most ridiculous sized portions. I literally got 5 pieces of cauliflower and that we're so tiny for like $10 and today I got a $12 chopped salad that is the size of a very small bowl of soup. Are they kidding? You can get better quality and portion size almost anywhere else. Fail!!

Four of us on Saturday 2:00 pm some what busy food was good appetizer the spinach dip very good The water refills slow split two salad bowls and two small pizzas with the appetizer 75.00 its pizza so I think the price is at the upper end

I love their crispy mac and cheese, corn guacamole with chips, and all of their pizzas are great. Their food tastes fresh and well prepared. The pizza is crisp and flavorful, and is one of my favorite pizzas.  The location is in the very happening and vibrant town of Walnut Creek. Walking around is a delight, and the restaurant carries a similar well-designed and festive mood.  The only star I take off is for slightly slow service. The waiters seem overloaded at times and I wish it had been faster, but the overall experience is still great. It feels like a local restaurant rather than a chain restaurant. Love it, and will definitely be back!
Although the wait staff was quite friendly  The food was good The prices were way tooooo much.  Not worth that much money.

We went in on a busy Friday night and ordered a chicken pizza and a salmon salad. The crust was burnt and the salmon was very dry. We mentioned it to our waiter and he said why didn't we let him know sooner but because it was a very busy Friday night we could not get his attention. The food has definitely gone downhill since they've moved.  Will not return. And with the additional lack of customer service, would not recommend this restaurant.

We looove the new & improved CPK. Originally thought that this was a bad move... after all, the last location was perfectly situated in-between our fav. Shopping spots: lululemon, Nordies & anthropologie. Turns out, the new space is better! Menu continues to evolve & wow non red meat eaters  like me. Parking: free & easily accessible. New look is awesome! Very hip. Rustic wood, fresh herbs on shelves  upon entering, awesome bar & outdoor seating. They made a few mistakes, but manager was made aware & took care of us immediately. Showed real concern & took off our check & offered to make again! And bonus: he offered dessert on the house too!!! Wow, good ol' fashion customer service from a big chain store who can afford it. Love it!! Will def. be back. Thank you! Ps. Desserts are too die for

Every since they changed locations, their service has gotten worse. I literally waited 15 minutes up front to be seated. There was no one there to help me and employees watched me stand there but offered no help. Keep in mind there was still an hour before closing. After finally getting a seat, the food took forever to come. About 30 minutes later -we just ordered pasta and it was just the 3 of us. Not a great experience

Today was one of the single hardest days that I've had to experience. We lost our home of 29 years in the Tubbs fire in Santa Rosa. The staff at this CPK were so sweet and kind to my partner, my friend, and I when we told them what happened. They only charged us for three drinks and comped the rest of our meal. Thank you so much for your kindness it means so much more than you could ever know.

Just can't see myself ever returning to this CPK. Used to be a favorite of mine, however service and quality of food as well as ease of ordering has become too much to bare. Don't waste your time, or hard earned money on this place. Service is slow, take out is a bit of a joke. Very disorganized. Always something wrong with our order.

Miss the original bright sunny location across from the Barnes & Noble no longer there.  This new location sits over a deep dark parking garage & it isn't much brighter in the restaurant where it is loud & echoes.  You can barely hear yourself think. It took 30 minutes for our food to arrive.  The $3 extra for chicken contained 5 tiny bits, not worth it!  We were very disappointed with our experience here.

All the dishes we got were excellent: The pea and barley soup is wonderful. The Quinoa salad was very hearty and fresh, the pizza was with the best crust we ever had in California. Highly recommended.

What a GREAT experience at CPK with Ryan, our waiter, and Daisy, the manager! Our family arrived at the restaurant about an hour from close then was accompanied by MORE family shortly after. Even with the crazy amount of people we had in our party, Ryan took care of us with no hurry or hesitation. Something went wrong with an order and Ryan, with the help of Daisy, quickly fixed the issue. Daisy came and apologies shortly after for he discrepancy and took care of the item for us. Usually when things go wrong in a restaurant I don't receive the attention that this chain gave this evening. I appreciate both employees and will be coming back to this location for that fact only.

California Pizza Kitchen has knocked it out of the park with there new menu started with an amazing dirty martini topped with complimentary hot bread and olive oil dipping sauce, manager recommended the new Rib Eye steak and potatoes which was outstanding medium rare to perfection deserts was salted Carmel pudding along with the butter cake (Don't look at the calories) was totally worth it.

We came here for the great pizzas they had. Pizzas were OK but they seemed very short staffed and everyone seemed like running around with panic. Our waitress got the wrong order for our son so he had to wait an additional 10-15 minutes to get his food. Than we noticed that the floor was VERY dirty. Napkins, straws, food everywhere. The bathroom was the same, very dirty and there were no napkins. Overall it was an OK experience.

I went to California Pizza Kitchen for a school fundraiser! For a Friday night, the wait time was about 25 minutes. I ordered the orchard sangria and the California club pizza. It was sorta like a salad on a pizza. It had a lot of arugula, if you don't like arugula, I would not recommend!  But the service at CPK was great.
Best pizza in CA. Their lunch combinations are fabulous. Always a safe and trusted go to. Fun happy hour and good service in the bar.

I can't believe we've waited so long to try this place out. The food was really good and the service was okay. I tried the chicken Milanese and the wife tried the penne pasta. They were both really good. The ingredients were really fresh and tasty. The dinnerware was really clean too. The complimentary bread was also really good. They have their own parking with ample space. The restaurant isn't super loud and dirty like the Cheesecake Factory. I would definitely pick CPK over the Cheesecake Factory.

3/5 - One star because we were seated and served our food quickly, another star for our nice waitress, and another star for the tasty bread they give you. Unfortunately, the pricing did not reflect the quality of the food. My pizza crust was partially burnt and not worth $14. My mom's half salad was 90% lettuce and no toppings for $12. Dumplings appetizer and the bread were the best part. Next time I come, I think I'll just order off of the appetizer menu.

I love this CPK! The service is so friendly and the manager, Seth really gives you a personal experience. We've been in a few times for dinner and he always comes to say hello! I also come during lunch and I love their well-priced lunch duo. Also bc it's brand new the decor is modern and clean! So lucky to have this place nearby and such wonderful staff running it!
